37 // Basic types and constants
38 // =========================
39 
40 // The XMP_... types are used on the off chance that the ..._t types present a problem. In that
41 // case only the declarations of the XMP_... types needs to change, not all of the uses. These
42 // types are used where fixed sizes are required in order to have a known ABI for a DLL build.
43 
44 #if XMP_MacBuild | XMP_iOSBuild
45 
46  typedef int8_t XMP_Int8;
47  typedef int16_t XMP_Int16;
48  typedef int32_t XMP_Int32;
49  typedef int64_t XMP_Int64;
50 
51  typedef uint8_t XMP_Uns8;
52  typedef uint16_t XMP_Uns16;
53  typedef uint32_t XMP_Uns32;
54  typedef uint64_t XMP_Uns64;
55 
56 #elif XMP_WinBuild
57 
58  typedef signed char XMP_Int8;
59  typedef signed short XMP_Int16;
60  typedef signed long XMP_Int32;
61  typedef signed long long XMP_Int64;
62 
63  typedef unsigned char XMP_Uns8;
64  typedef unsigned short XMP_Uns16;
65  typedef unsigned long XMP_Uns32;
66  typedef unsigned long long XMP_Uns64;
67 
68 #elif XMP_UNIXBuild
69 
70  #if ! XMP_64
71 
72  typedef signed char XMP_Int8;
73  typedef signed short XMP_Int16;
74  typedef signed long XMP_Int32;
75  typedef signed long long XMP_Int64;
76 
77  typedef unsigned char XMP_Uns8;
78  typedef unsigned short XMP_Uns16;
79  typedef unsigned long XMP_Uns32;
80  typedef unsigned long long XMP_Uns64;
81 
82  #else
83 
84  typedef signed char XMP_Int8;

86  typedef signed int XMP_Int32;
87  typedef signed long long XMP_Int64;
88 
89  typedef unsigned char XMP_Uns8;
90  typedef unsigned short XMP_Uns16;
91  typedef unsigned int XMP_Uns32;
92  typedef unsigned long long XMP_Uns64;
93 
94  #endif
95 
96 #else
97 
98  #error "XMP environment error - must define one of XMP_MacBuild, XMP_WinBuild, XMP_UNIXBuild or XMP_iOSBuild"
99 
100 #endif

499 #define XMP_SetOption(var,opt) var |= (opt)
500 #define XMP_ClearOption(var,opt) var &= ~(opt)

996 enum {
997  kXMP_CharLittleEndianMask = 1,
998  kXMP_Char16BitMask = 2,
999  kXMP_Char32BitMask = 4
1000 };
1001 
1003 enum {
1005  kXMP_Char8Bit = 0,
1007  kXMP_Char16BitBig = kXMP_Char16BitMask,
1009  kXMP_Char16BitLittle = kXMP_Char16BitMask | kXMP_CharLittleEndianMask,
1011  kXMP_Char32BitBig = kXMP_Char32BitMask,
1013  kXMP_Char32BitLittle = kXMP_Char32BitMask | kXMP_CharLittleEndianMask,
1015  kXMP_CharUnknown = 1
1016 };
1017 
1050 
1051 #define XMP_CharFormIs16Bit(f) ( ((int)(f) & kXMP_Char16BitMask) != 0 )
1052 #define XMP_CharFormIs32Bit(f) ( ((int)(f) & kXMP_Char32BitMask) != 0 )
1053 #define XMP_CharFormIsBigEndian(f) ( ((int)(f) & kXMP_CharLittleEndianMask) == 0 )
1054 #define XMP_CharFormIsLittleEndian(f) ( ((int)(f) & kXMP_CharLittleEndianMask) != 0 )
1055 #define XMP_GetCharSize(f) ( ((int)(f)&6) == 0 ? 1 : (int)(f)&6 )
1056 #define XMP_CharToSerializeForm(cf) ( (XMP_OptionBits)(cf) )
1057 #define XMP_CharFromSerializeForm(sf) ( (XMP_Uns8)(sf) )

1314 class XMP_Error {

1323  XMP_Error ( XMP_Int32 _id, XMP_StringPtr _errMsg ) : id(_id), errMsg(_errMsg), notified(false) {};
1324

1327 
1329  inline XMP_StringPtr GetErrMsg() const { return errMsg; };
1330 
1332  inline XMP_Bool IsNotified() const { return notified; }
1333 
1335  inline void SetNotified() { notified = true; };

1342  XMP_StringPtr errMsg;
1344  XMP_Bool notified;
